name: Engineering Override
desc:
Increases the number of hullmods that can be built in by %s. Building in hullmods no longer requires mastery points and costs %s fewer credits.

Renders this ship unable to benefit from any mastery effect. Additionally, each installed S-mod decreases the ship's peak combat readiness by %s.
short: Allows crude S-mod integration without mastery

name: Analysis Package
desc:
If installed on a ship with a civilian hull spec, increases the fleet's mastery point gain across all civilian hull types by up to %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, with diminishing returns, and capped to %s.

If installed on a ship with a combat hull spec, increases the fleet's mastery point gain across all combat hull types by up to %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, with diminishing returns, and capped to %s.

The effect is applied according to the ship's hull spec, not the ship itself, so modifying a particular ship's role, such as through the use of Militarized Subsystems, will not have any effect on this hullmod.
sModDesc: Negates the effect's diminishing returns, but not its cap, and applies the bonus to both civilian and combat hulls.
